entry.title: LHCb detector status and commissioning
entry.summary: The LHCb detector status and commissioning is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: HCP06 proceedings for references

entry.title: Polarized gamma beams on the base of excited crystal
entry.summary: Possibilities of creating high energy polarized photon beams at the end of bremsstrahlung spectrum and a method for analysis of degree of the beam polarization are considered in this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Lead-glass detector for NA49
entry.summary: An experimental report on the construction and operation of a lead-glass calorimeter at the CERN-NA49 experiment is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, contribution to RHIC School 03, Budapest

entry.title: Overview of the DHCAL Project
entry.summary: We review the status and plans of the Digital Hadron Calorimeter with Resistive Plate Chambers project.

entry.title: Development of an electrical model of a resistive micromegas
entry.summary: We have developped a model to simulate the behavior of a resistive micromegas (MICROMEsh GAseous Structure) detector to a discharge using an electronic software (Virtuoso).

entry.title: Active correlations technique: Schmidt equation with partially free order
entry.summary: LDSC (Linked decay signal combination) is modified taking into account application of active correlation technique to suppress beam associated backgrounds. Examples of application are presented.

entry.title: Single solenoidal magnetic system for Iron-free detector
entry.summary: We consider a single solenoidal system for possible usage in Iron-free detectors for future linear colliders
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Extension of calibration of UV-VIS spectrometer from VIS to UV region by using single bubble sonoluminesce
entry.summary: A simple method to calibrate UV-VIS spectrometer by means of single bubble sonoluminescence is presented and tested.

entry.title: Technical Design Report for the Panda Forward Spectrometer Calorimeter
entry.summary: This document is devoted to the electromagnetic calorimeter of the Forward Spectrometer and describes the design considerations, the technical layout, the expected performance, and the production readiness.

entry.title: Simple device for scanning image
entry.summary: The simple device for scanning image is described. It has much in common with usual TV camera, with an electron beam replaced by an optical one. After the general description of the device, we present a simple experimental illustration.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, Latex, 2 eps figure

entry.title: New developments of photodetectors for the Lake Baikal Neutrino Experiment
entry.summary: New developments of photodetectors for the lake Baikal neutrino experiment are described. Some test results of photodetectors at the lake Baikal are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 3 figures, talk at 7th International Conference on Advanced Technology and Particle Physics, Villa Olmo, Como 15-19 October 2001

entry.title: Currents Induced by Charges Moving in Semiconductor
entry.summary: The method of computation of currents induced on electrodes by charges moving in vacuum was introduced by Shockley and Ramo. In presented paper, this method is generalised for charges moving in a media.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, no figures

entry.title: ALTRO and TPC Performance of ALICE
entry.summary: The extraction and optimisation of the ALTRO Parameters out of the ALICE TPC data is described, including the performance measurment of this set. The ion tail of a signal pulse and the variation is firstly measured and quantified.

entry.title: Three-dimensional visualisation of tracks in OPERA nuclear emulsion films
entry.summary: The possibility of a three-dimensional visualisation/reconstruction of tracks in nuclear emulsion films using X-ray imaging is described in this paper. The feasibility of the technique is established with experimental results.

entry.title: Crystal vibration limit of nanoscale dynamic etalon. Rough estimate
entry.summary: The paper analyzes the limits of nanoscale dynamic etalon caused by thermal vibration of crystalline structure. It is shown that exactly sufficiently long one-dimensional defect of crystal lattice should confine the standard accuracy within angstroms.

entry.title: Forward Proton Detectors at High Luminosity at the LHC
entry.summary: We discuss the special challenges posed by measuring diffractive and forward physics at the LHC at high luminosity and the solutions proposed by the FP420 R&D collaboration.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, no pictures, contribution to the proceedings of ICHEP06

entry.title: A general track reconstruction scheme and its application to the OPERA drift tubes
entry.summary: A general reconstruction and calibration procedure for tracking and wire position determination of the OPERA drift tubes is presented. The mathematics of the pattern recognition and the track fit are explained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages

entry.title: Track Based Alignment of the ATLAS Silicon Detectors with the Robust Alignment Algorithm
entry.summary: The Robust Alignment algorithm for the ATLAS silicon detectors is presented. It is an iterative method based on centering residual and overlap residual distributions. Tests on simulated and real data are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 6 figures

entry.title: Results from the Commissioning Run of the CMS Silicon Strip Tracker
entry.summary: Results of the CMS Silicon Strip Tracker performance are presented as obtained in the setups where the tracker is being commissioned.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of the 10th ICATPP Conference on Astroparticle, Particle, Space Physics, Detectors and Medical Physics Applications. 6 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Collimator R&D
entry.summary: The importance of collimator R&D with test beam facilities is demonstrated with the example of ILC collimator studies at SLAC End Station A. Related LHC collimator aspects and longer term plans are addressed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 10 figures. presented at IDTB07, Fermilab

entry.title: An Approximate Calculation of Active Pixel Sensors Temporal Noise for High Energy Physics
entry.summary: A simple calculation of the temporal noise of an elementary pixel is made. The equivalent noise charge takes into consideration the series and parallel noise as a function of the observation time.
entry.arxiv:comment: Research Note

entry.title: Commissioning of the ATLAS Inner Tracking Detector
entry.summary: In this contribution to ICHEP08 conference, we give the status of the commissioning of the ATLAS Inner (Tracking) Detector.
entry.arxiv:comment: Parallel talk at ICHEP08, Philadelphia, USA, July 2008. 6 pages, PDFLaTeX, 7 jpg figures

entry.title: Simplified PMT Model
entry.summary: A simplified model is proposed based on the characteristics of the photomultiplier tube (PMT). The Model is compared to the available data, and it successes to reproduce the saturation profile of the PMT. The model also adds clarification about how the PMT works.

entry.title: Some Practical Applications of Dark Matter Research
entry.summary: Two practical spin-offs from the development of cryogenic dark matter detectors are presented. One in materials research, the other in biology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages,4 figures

entry.title: R&D efforts towards a neutrino factory
entry.summary: The R&D efforts towards a neutrino factory are outlined with special emphasis on the muon cooling issue and the data collected for target optimization.
entry.arxiv:comment: contribution to NOW08, Conca Specchiulla, Otranto, 2008

entry.title: Research Director's Report
entry.summary: Recent development of the detector activities and related events are reported and some details of the newly completed management structure are described. Also the plans for processes after the LOI due date are introduced.
entry.arxiv:comment: LCWS/ILC2008 Proceedings

entry.title: ILCWS08 Test Beam Summary
entry.summary: A summary is given of the high energy test beam facilities around the world. Attention is placed on the capabilities and availability of each. A short description is given of what kind of additional facilities are required in the future to support ILC detector research.

entry.title: Experience with the AHCAL Calibration System in the Test Beam
entry.summary: We present herein our experience with the calibration system in the CALICE AHCAL prototype in the test beam and discuss characterizations of the SiPM response curves.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 7 figures, LCWS08 proceedings

entry.title: Overview of Studies on the SPIROC Chip Characterisation
entry.summary: This note reports the results of extensive measurements of the SPIROC ASIC charaterisation. This chip is forseen to be used in the next generation of the Analogue Hadronic Calorimeter (AHCAL) prototype for the International Linear Collider.
entry.arxiv:comment: 41 pages, 46 figures, PDF

entry.title: CALICE Report to the DESY Physics Research Committee
entry.summary: We present an overview of the CALICE activities on calorimeter development for a future linear collider. We report on test beam analysis results, the status of prototype development and future plans.

entry.title: Dynamic Alignment Method at the LHC
entry.summary: The dynamic alignment method of the forward proton detectors proposed by the CDF Collaboration is reviewed. Applicability of the method at the LHC is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 2 figures
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Advances in High Energy Physics, vol. 2012, Article ID 428305

entry.title: Bias voltage Control of Avalanche Photo-Diode Using a Window Comparator
entry.summary: This work aims at controlling the bias voltage of APDs, used for single photon detection, with a micro-controller through pulse height comparison.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2011 IEEE Summer Topicals Conference proceeding

entry.title: Report on the Forward Tracking Detector of the International Large Detector
entry.summary: An overview of some progress and R&D activities of the Spanish network for future accelerators concerning the forward tracker detector of the International Large Detector is shown.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 Figures, LCWS11 Conf. proceedings

entry.title: The Capabilities of the upgraded MIPP experiment with respect to Hypernuclear physics
entry.summary: We describe the state of analysis of the MIPP experiment, its plans to upgrade the experiment and the impact such an upgraded experiment will have on hypernuclear physics.

entry.title: The Long Baseline Neutrino Experiment (LBNE) Water Cherenkov Detector (WCD) Conceptual Design Report (CDR)
entry.summary: Conceptual Design Report developed for the Water Cherenkov Detector (WCD) option for the far detector of the Long Baseline Neutrino Experiment.
entry.arxiv:comment: 386 pages, 139 figures

entry.title: Scaling of gamma-spectra registered by semiconductor detectors
entry.summary: Scaling properties of gamma-spectra recorded by semiconductor detectors are investigated. For practical purposes the method of simulation multicomponent spectra using single experimental spectrum are suggested.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: PMT Test Facility at MPIK Heidelberg and Double Chooz Super Vertical Slice
entry.summary: Proceedings supplement for conference poster at Neutrino 2010, Athens, Greece.

entry.title: Resistive MSGC with double layered electrodes
entry.summary: The first successful attempts to optimize the electric field in Resistive Microstrip Gas Chamber (RMSGC) using additional field shaping strips located inside the detector substrate are described.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at 13th RD51 Collaboration meeting, CERN, Febr. 2014

entry.title: Wideband Microstrip Antenna Design
entry.summary: This paper covers wideband planar antenna design approaches. Modeling and simulation results were obtained using ADS simulation software and have demonstrated feasibility for fabrication of a wideband patch antenna configuration for moderately low-power applications.

entry.title: A comparison of possibilities to measure the coordinates of a moving hot body using an infrared telescope or Doppler radar
entry.summary: A comparison of the sensitivities of methods which allow us to determine the coordinates of a moving hot body is made.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages

entry.title: A light tracking system to measure structural deformations
entry.summary: Light tracking systems have been used in recent years to study wandering phenomena in atmospheric optics. We propose to employ this technology in structural deformation sensing.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Test study on the RPS of TMSR-SF1 reactor
entry.summary: The reactor protection system (RPS), as a 1E-level safety system, should be designed and developed following a series of nuclear laws and technical disciplines.

entry.title: Physics Opportunities with a Secondary K0_L Beam at JLab
entry.summary: Following a Letter of Intent submitted to PAC43 at JLab in this talk we discuss the possibility to create a secondary K0_L beam in Hall-D to be used with GlueX detector for spectroscopy of excited hyperons.

entry.title: Numerical solution to the Bloch equations, paramagnetic solutions under wideband continuous radio frequency irradiation in a pulsed magnetic field
entry.summary: A novel NMR experimental scheme, called wide band continuous wave NMR, is presented in this article.

entry.title: Electron Lifetime Determination in Semiconductor Gamma Detector Arrayes
entry.summary: Hecht equation is not adequate to analyzing standard measurements, of the mobility-lifetime product, carried out with single pixels of detector arrays. A modified expression is calculated, in order to have correct mobility-lifetime values out of experimental data.

entry.title: Piezoelectricity for Nondestructive Testing of Crystal Surfaces
entry.summary: A stress is applied at the flat face and the apex of a prismatic piezoelectric crystal. The voltage generated at these points differs in order of magnitude. The result may be used to nondestructively test the uniformity of surfaces of piezoelectric crystals.

entry.title: LHC-B Ring Imaging Cherenkov Detector
entry.summary: The progress towards the realisation of the LHC-B Ring Imaging Cherenkov detector is reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages. 5 postscript figures + 1 postscript preprint logo + 1 LaTeX file + 1 style file. Also available at http://ppewww.ph.gla.ac.uk/preprints/97/14/ Invited talk given at Beauty'97

entry.title: Review of Cosmic Ray experiments with underground detectors
entry.summary: The most important underground detectors addressing Cosmic Ray physics are described, with a special emphasis on the description of the used technology.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at 6th International Conference on advanced Technology and Particle Physics, Villa Olmo, Como, Italy, October 5-9, 1998, To be published in Nucl. Phys. B, Proc. Suppl

entry.title: Optimization of thermal noise in multi-loop pendulum suspensions for use in interferometric gravitational-wave detectors
entry.summary: We study the thermal-noise spectrum of multi-loop pendulum suspensions for test masses in interferometric gravitational-wave detectors. The dependence of the thermal noise on suspension parameters and on properties of the wire material is discussed for the situation in which the losses are dominated by the internal friction in the pendulum wires.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Study of nucleating efficiency of superheated droplets by neutrons
entry.summary: Superheated droplets are proven to be excelent detectors for neutrons and could be used as a neutron dosimeter. To detect accurately the volume of the vapour formed upon nucleation and hence to observe the nucleation quantitatively an air displacement system has been developed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1page, 1 fig

entry.title: Performance of a large limited streamer tube cell in drift mode
entry.summary: The performance of a large (3x3 $cm^2$) streamer tube cell in drift mode is shown. The detector space resolution has been studied using cosmic muons crossing an high precision silicon telescope. The experimental results are compared with a GARFIELD simulation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 7 figures. Accepted by Nucl. Instr. and Methods A

entry.title: National Ignition Facility (NIF) Control Network Design and Analysis
entry.summary: This paper describes the requirements, design, and analysis of the control network for the National Ignition Facility (NIF). The network uses Ethernet technology throughout and ATM is used for efficient digital video transport.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 figures, ICALEPCS 2001

entry.title: Continually Working Multiwire Porous Detectors of Radiation
entry.summary: Performance of the known porous multiwire radiation detectors is stable in the mode of pulsed voltage supply. The results of the study of multiwire porous detector operated at constant voltage supply are presented in this article. It is shown that the detector's performance is stable, and its spatial resolution $\Delta x \beta \pm 60 \mu m$.
entry.arxiv:comment: ps file

entry.title: Multi-energy techniques for radiographic monitoring of chemical composition
entry.summary: A theoretical model of multi-energy radiography (MER) are proposed. It is shown that, as distinct from the conventional radiography, MER allows identification of organic substances and control of their chemical composition. Broad prospects are noted for MER application, specifically, for detection of prohibited substances (explosives, drugs, etc.) during customs and anti-terrorist safety inspection.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure, RMA-2002 Conference, Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA

entry.title: Dynamical investigation of macromolecular hybridization bioassays
entry.summary: A novel sensoric technique for the dynamical in situ investigation of a hybridization bio assay is presented, which utilizes a metal bead labeling method. Therein, hybridization results in an increased metal coverage on parts of a substrate, where it takes place. Our sensing principle relies on the measurement of the radio frequency impedance of the hybridization spots. We propose several examples for sensor devices.

entry.title: Database independent Migration of Objects into an Object-Relational Database
entry.summary: This paper reports on the CERN-based WISDOM project which is studying the serialisation and deserialisation of data to/from an object database (objectivity) and ORACLE 9i.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 pages, 18 figures; CMS CERN Conference Report cr02_014
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. of the 2th International Workshop on Autonomous Decentralized Systems(IWADS'02) Beijing, China NOvember 2002

entry.title: CARPS: An integrated proposal and data collection system
entry.summary: Modern scripting languages and database tools combined provide a new framework for developing beam-line control and data management software. The CARPS system supports data collection by storing low level beam-line control commands in a database and playing these commands back to collect data sets. This system is combined with proposal and data management tools for support of both local and remote users.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at NOBUGS2002 Conference, NIST, Gaithersburg, MD NOBUGS abstract identifier NOBUGS2002/049

entry.title: FEATHER: A Fast Intra-pulse Feedback System for the JLC
entry.summary: Ground motion at the Future JLC detector may affect beam alignment and cause huge luminosity loss. The FEATHER (FEedback AT High Energy Requirements) project addresses this problem by designing a fast intra-pulse feedback system that will correct the observed beam offset.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of the 8th Accelerator and Particle Physics Institute (APPI 2003), Iwate, Japan. FEATHER homepage: http://acfahep.kek.jp/subg/ir/feather/

entry.title: The dispersion formula and the light group velocity in a water
entry.summary: The parametric formulas are obtained whereby the refractive index and the light group velocity could be calculated for any water state (salinity, pressure, temperature) inside of the light wavelength region from 200 nm to 1200 nm. These formulas are suitable to be used in underwater neutrino telescope activity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 9 pages, 5 eps figure, 1 table, (To be submitted to Nucl. Instrum. Meth. A)

entry.title: Some Theoretical Estimations of Spatial Distribution of Compton Backscattered Laser Photons Beam
entry.summary: Spatial distribution of intensity, degree and direction of linear polarization of tagged photon beam, which is obtained due to Compton backscattering of laser light on high-energy electron beam, are calculated. Effects of angular dispersion and spatial spread of electron beam are taken into account. Calculations have been carried out for the example of LEGS facility.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 13 PostSript figures

entry.title: Spectra of pyroelectric X-ray generator
entry.summary: The construction of X-ray generator based on a pyroelectric crystal LiNbO3 is described. Some properties of radiation spectra from the X-ray generator are presented. Measurements of the spectra were performed at heating and cooling of the crystal with copper and chromium targets. The maximum energy in the X-ray spectrum versus crystal temperature is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 7 figures, 10 references

entry.title: Instrumentation
entry.summary: In this course, given at the school in 3 parts of 75 minutes each, we will discuss the physics of particle detection, the basic designs and working principles of detectors, and, as an example with more details, some detectors for particle identification.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lecture course given at the 2nd Latin American School of High Energy Physics, San Miguel Regla, Mexico, June 1-14, 2003. To be published in a CERN Yellow Report

entry.title: Comment on "On the negative value of dielectric permittivity of the water surface layer" [Appl. Phys. Lett. 83, 4506 (2003)]
entry.summary: The recent interpretation of the positive resonance frequency shift in dielectric resonators loaded by water is reviewed. Instead of the invoked negative dielectric constant of water surface layer, it is demonstrated that the experimental results are fully reproduced by taking into account the dielectric losses of the sample.
entry.arxiv:comment: PDF Acrobat 4.0 file, 2 pages, 2 figures, submitted to Appl. Phys. Lett

entry.title: Stability studies of nanosecond light sources based on blue ultra bright LEDs
entry.summary: We present the results of stability studies of nanosecond light sources based on single quantum well (SQW) InGaN/GaN ultra bright blue LEDs. It is shown that the light yield of such light sources and their timing characteristics don't deteriorate even after 10^10 total pulses. The longterm stability of the sources light yield is better than 1%.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 7 figures

entry.title: Micropattern Gaseous Detectors
entry.summary: Currently a revolution is taking place in the development of gaseous detectors of photons and particles. Parallel plate-type and wire-type detectors which dominated for years in high energy and space flight experiments are now being replaced by recently invented Micropattern gaseous detectors. We will now review the main achievements in this field and discuss the most promising directions in future developments and applications.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at the 42nd Workshop: Innovative Detectors for Supercolliders Erice, September 2004

entry.title: Transition Radiation Spectroscopy with Prototypes of the ALICE TRD
entry.summary: We present measurements of the transition radiation (TR) spectrum produced in an irregular radiator at different electron momenta. The data are compared to simulations of TR from a regular radiator.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 5 Figures, Proceedings for "TRDs for the 3rd millennium" (Sept. 4-7, 2003, Bari, Italy)

entry.title: The measurements of 2200 ETL9351 type photomultipliers for the Borexino experiment with the photomultiplier testing facility at LNGS
entry.summary: The results of tests of more than 2200 ETL9351 type PMTs for the Borexino detector with the PMT test facility are presented. The PMTs characteristics relevant for the proper detector operation and modeling are discussed in detail.
entry.arxiv:comment: 31 pages, 26 figures, 3 tables

entry.title: Fast Detector Simulation Using Lelaps
entry.summary: Lelaps is a fast detector simulation program which reads StdHep generator files and produces SIO or LCIO output files. It swims particles through detectors taking into account magnetic fields, multiple scattering and dE/dx energy loss. It simulates parameterized showers in EM and hadronic calorimeters and supports gamma conversions and decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 1 figure, latex, uses sprocl.tex (included)

entry.title: Digital imaging of charged particle track structures with a low-pressure optical time projection chamber
entry.summary: We describe first results obtained with a track structure imaging system for measuring the ionisation topology of charged particles in a low-pressure gas. The detection method is based on a time projection chamber (TPC) filled with low-pressure triethylamine (TEA). Images of ionisation tracks of electrons, protons, and heavier ions are presented and analysed.

entry.title: Imaging of microscopic features of charged-particle tracks in a low-pressure gas
entry.summary: An imaging system for measuring the spatial distribtion of charged particle tracks in a low-pressure gas is presented. The method is based on an optically read out time projection chamber. Results of experiments with fast heavy ions are shown.

entry.title: Development and application of an optical TPC for charged particle track structure imaging in microdosimetry
entry.summary: An imaging system for measuring the track structure of charged particles in a low-pressure gas is presented. We describe the experimental method and compare experimental results with first results of a simulation of the chamber response.

entry.title: Studies of "Kapustinsky's" light pulser timing characteristics
entry.summary: We present the results of studies of a nanosecond light pulser built following J.S.Kapustinsky et al original design and using bright InGaN/GaN ultraviolet and blue LEDs produced by NICHIA CHEMICAL. It is shown how timing characteristics of the pulser depend on the type of LED and the value of power supply voltage.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 5 figures, to be submitted to NIM A

entry.title: The D0 Run II Trigger System
entry.summary: I present the current status of the D0 trigger system in Run II at the Tevatron.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 figures, To appear in the proceedings of DPF 2004: Annual Meeting of the Division of Particles and Fields (DPF) of the American Physical Society (APS), Riverside, California, 26-31 Aug 2004

entry.title: Novel 3D Clustering Algorithm and Two Particle Separation with Tile HCAL
entry.summary: Based on a novel shower reconstruction algorithm, the study of two particle separation with tile hadron calorimeter (HCAL) is performed. The separability of two close-by particles is found to be strongly dependent on transverse and longitudinal segmentation of tile HCAL.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of International Conference on Linear Colliders, LCWS'04, Paris, 19-23 April 2004

entry.title: Calorimeters in Astro and Particle physics
entry.summary: In this article an attempt is made to review some of the original works leading to new developments of calorimeters which are so widely and successfully used in astro and particle physics experiments. This report is far from being complete and the author apologizes for omissions and misquotations.

author.name: Klaus Pretzl
author.arxiv:affiliation: Laboratory for High Energy Physics, University of Bern

entry.title: BESII Detector Simulation
entry.summary: A Monte Carlo program based on Geant3 has been developed for BESII detector simulation. The organization of the program is outlined, and the digitization procedure for simulating the response of various sub-detectors is described. Comparisons with data show that the performance of the program is generally satisfactory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 14 figures, uses elsart.cls, to be submitted to NIMA

entry.title: Free-Space Antenna Field/Pattern Retrieval in Reverberation Environments
entry.summary: Simple algorithms for retrieving free-space antenna field or directivity patterns from complex (field) or real (intensity) measurements taken in ideal reverberation environments are introduced and discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 2 figures, submitted to IEEE Antennas and Wireless Propagation Letters

entry.title: Development of a TDC to equip a Liquid Xenon PET prototype
entry.summary: A Time to Digital Converter was designed (CMOS 0.35 $\mum) in order to be used in Liquid Xenon PET prototype. The circuit proved to be able to work at -120 degrees C, while showing a resolution of 250 ps. The circuit enables a low readout dead time (<90 ns) and provides a fully synchronous digital interface for easy data retrieval.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, submitted to IEEE Transactions on Nuclear Science

entry.title: Measuring the Beam Energy with Radiative Return Events
entry.summary: This paper studies the possibility to measure the centre of mass energy using e+e- -> Z,gamma -> mu+mu-,gamma events at the ILC. With L = 100 fb^-1 at sqrt(s) = 350 GeV a relative error of around 10^{-4} is possible. The potentially largest systematic uncertainty comes from the knowledge of the aspect ratio of the detector.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LCWS05, Stanford, March 2005

entry.title: Workload analysis of a cluster in a grid environment
entry.summary: With Grids, we are able to share computing resources and to provide for scientific communities a global trans-parent access to local facilities. In such an environment the problems of fair resource sharing and best usage arise. In this paper, the analysis of the LPC cluster usage (Clermont-Ferrand, France) in the EGEE Grid environment is done, and from the results a model for job arrival is proposed

entry.title: Electron/Pion Identification with ALICE TRD Prototypes using a Neural Network Algorithm
entry.summary: We study the electron/pion identification performance of the ALICE Transition Radiation Detector (TRD) prototypes using a neural network (NN) algorithm. Measurements were carried out for particle momenta from 2 to 6 GeV/c. An improvement in pion rejection by about a factor of 3 is obtained with NN compared to standard likelihood methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 9 Figures

entry.title: Simple acoustical technique for automated measurement of drift tube anode wire tension
entry.summary: We describe a simple and inexpensive acoustical technique that permits rapid, accurate and in-situ measurement of drift tube anode wire tensions even if the anode wire is electrically discontinuous.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 text pages, 6 figures. fixed typo, minor content change in sec 3

entry.title: Tera-sample-per-second Real-time Waveform Digitizer
entry.summary: We demonstrate a real-time transient waveform digitizer with a record 1 TSa/s (Tera-Sample/sec) sampling rate. This is accomplished by using a photonic time stretch preprocessor which slows down the electrical waveform before it is captured by an electronic digitizer.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 6 figures, submitted to Applied Physics Letters, Apr 2005

entry.title: A Method to check the Connectivity for the ATLAS TRT Detector
entry.summary: We report on a technique developed to diagnostic for non working readout channels of the Transition Radiation Tracker (TRT), one of the three inner detectors of the ATLAS experiment. From a detailled study, we show that 99.6 % of the readout channels of the TRT endcap-detector are perfectly operational.
entry.arxiv:comment: 32 pages

entry.title: Neutron shielding for particle astrophysics experiments
entry.summary: Particle astrophysics experiments often require large volume neutron shields which are formed from hydrogenous material. This note reviews some of the available materials in an attempt to find the most cost effective solution. Raw polymer pellets and Water Extended Polyester (WEP) ae discussed in detail. Suppliers for some materials are given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 0 figures

entry.title: General Thoughts about Tracking for a Linear Collider Detector
entry.summary: Basic scaling laws are used to compare the relative capabilities of gaseous and solid-state tracking. Conclusions are drawn in the context of physics processes expected to be at the focus of studies at the International Linear Collider.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure, to be submitted to the proceedings of the 2005 ALCPG & ILC Workshops, Snowmass, Colorado, August 14-28, 2005

entry.title: Particle Detector R&D
entry.summary: Recent results on the particle detector R&D for new accelerators are reviewed. Different approaches for the muon systems, hadronic and electromagnetic calorimeters, particle identification devices, and central trackers are discussed. Main emphasis is made on the detectors for the International Linear Collider and Super B-factory. A detailed description of a novel photodetector, a so called Silicon Photomultiplier, and its applications in scintillator detectors is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Review Talk at the Lepton and Photon Symposium, Uppsala, 2005

entry.title: The CMS Silicon Strip Tracker
entry.summary: With over 200 square meters of sensitive Silicon and almost 10 million readout channels, the Silicon Strip Tracker of the CMS experiment at the LHC will be the largest Silicon strip detector ever built. The design, construction and expected performance of the CMS Tracker is reviewed in the following.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 8 figures, talk given at XIX EPS NPDC Conference on "New Trends in Nuclear Physics Applications and Technology", September 5-9, 2005 Pavia, Italy

entry.title: The CMS Silicon Strip Tracker
entry.summary: The CMS collaboration is constructing the largest silicon tracker ever built with an active silicon area of 200 m^2 to provide robust charged particle tracking and vertex reconstruction within the 4T magnetic field of the CMS Solenoid. The design of the detector, the status of the construction and the performance of the substructures are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at PANIC05, Particles and Nuclei International Conference, Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA, 24-28 October, 2005

entry.title: Alignment of the Central D-Zero Detector
entry.summary: The alignment procedure of the Silicon Microstrip Tracker, SMT, and the Central Fiber Tracker, CFT, is described. Alignment uncertainties and resulting systematic errors in physics analyses are addressed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, 33 figures, presented at workshop on Tracking In high Multiplicity Environments (TIME'05) Zurich, October 3-7, 2005. Proceedings Nucl. Inst. Methods A

entry.title: START: low-noise efficient trigger for cosmic muons
entry.summary: Noise characteristics and MIP registration efficiency of the Scintillation Tile with MRS APD Light Readout (START) were measured with cosmic particles. Encouraging results open a broad range of possibilities for using START in large-scale applications, requiring low-noise, efficient and stable trigger for cosmic muons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures, submitted to Elsevier Science

entry.title: Capacity formulas in MWPC: some critical reflexions
entry.summary: An approximate analytical expression for "capacitance" of MWPC configurations circulates in the literature since decades and is copied over and over again. In this paper we will try to show that this formula corresponds to a physical quantity that is different from what it is usually thought to stand for.

entry.title: Dynamic phase microscopy: measurements of translational displacements at sub-nanometer scale
entry.summary: Dynamic phase microscopy has been applied for measurements of nanometer-scale displacements of a piezoelectric scanner. This scanner, which was designed for calibration purposes for scanning probe microscopy and TEM, exhibited a linear and hysteresis-free translation in the 0.05-20 nm range. The voltage-activated motion is described by a coefficient of 0.03 \pm 0.005 nm/V.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Triple-GEM performance in He-based mixtures
entry.summary: The performance of triple-GEM detectors in He+N2 gas mixtures is studied in the range of 1-10 atm. The results obtained are relevant in the field of minimization of ionic space-charge effect in the TPC and neutron detection.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 2 figures. Presented at the International Conference on Linear Colliders, Paris, April 19-23, 2004

entry.title: The Layout of the photon collider at the ILC
entry.summary: One of the interaction regions at the linear colliders should be compatible both with e+e- and gamma-gamma, gamma-electron modes of operation. In this paper, the differences in requirements and possible design solutions are discussed.

author.name: V. I. Telnov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Nuclear Physics, Novosibirsk, Russia

entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at LCWS06, Bangalore, India, March 2006, to be published in Indian Journal of Physics; 3pp, Latex, 1 .eps figure

entry.title: A hybrid method for calorimetry with subnanolitre samples using Schottky junctions
entry.summary: A micrometer scale calorimeter realized by using Schottky junctions as a thermometer is presented. Combined with a hybrid experimental method, it enables simultaneous time-resolved measurements of variations in both the energy and the heat capacity of subnanolitre samples.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 6 figures

entry.title: Silicon Sensors implemented on p-type substrates for high radiation resistance applications
entry.summary: Silicon based micropattern detectors are essential elements of modern high energy physics experiments. Cost effectiveness and high radiation resistance are two important requirements for technologies to be used in inner tracking devices. Processes based on p-type substrates have very strong appeal for these applications. Recent results and prototype efforts under way are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 2 figures; invited paper at Vertex 2006, Perugia, Italy, september 2006

entry.title: Can a charged ring levitate a neutral, polarizable object? Can Earnshaw's Theorem be extended to such objects?
entry.summary: Stable electrostatic levitation and trapping of a neutral, polarizable object by a charged ring is shown to be theoretically impossible. Earnshaw's Theorem precludes the existence of such a stable, neutral particle trap.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Muon Telescope at BEO - Moussala
entry.summary: A muon telescope based on 8 water cherenkov detectors was mounted at Basic Environmental Observatory - Moussala - Institute for Nuclear Research and Nuclear Energy - Bulgarian Academy of Science. The telescope will be used for continuous measuring the intensity of the muon component of cosmic rays, exploring its variations and possible correlations with environment parameters. A detailed description of the device is presented in this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 5 figures ; 2 additional pages with 4 pictures

entry.title: Estimation of Weighting Potential for a TPC
entry.summary: In this work, we have computed the three dimensional weighting potential, field and pad response function (PRF) of typical time projection chambers (TPC) using a recently formulated and developed boundary element method solver, namely, the nearly exact BEM solver. A realistic geometry of the device is found to have significant influence on the estimation of signal generation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented in XVII DAE-BRNS High Energy Physics Symposium, December 11-15, 2006, IIT, Kharagpur, India

entry.title: Water Vapour Effects in Mass Measurement
entry.summary: Water vapour inside the mass comparator enclosure is a critical parameter. In fact, fluctuations of this parameter during mass weighing can lead to errors in the determination of an unknown mass. To control that, a proposal method is given and tested. Preliminary results of our observation of water vapour sorption and desorption processes from walls and mass standard are reported.

entry.title: Multiple hits in wire chambers and other particle detectors
entry.summary: We propose an analysis of the dead time losses in counting imaging detectors such as MWPC which can resolve $k$ simultaneous hits, and analyze in more detail an $X-Y$ detector which has a third wire set which allows for the recognition of simultaneous impacts.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Project to install roman pot detectors at 220 m in ATLAS
entry.summary: We give a short description of the project to install roman pot detectors at 220 m from the interaction point in ATLAS. This project is dedicated to hard diffractive measurements at high luminosity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings for the DIS 2007 workshop, Munich, April 2007

entry.title: Status of the H1 Very Forward Proton Spectrometer
entry.summary: The Very Forward Proton Spectrometer (VFPS) of the H1 experiment at HERA is collecting data since 2005. The fiber detectors in the Roman pots located at 218 and 222m downstream from the H1 interaction point, tag and measure diffractively scattered protons with a high acceptance in the $\xpom$ range [0.01, 0.025]. The experimental set up and the spectrometer tagging performance using diffractive events collected during 2006 and 2007 are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of DIS07, 4 pages

entry.title: CDF Central Preshower and Crack Detector Upgrade
entry.summary: The CDF Central Preshower and Crack Detector Upgrade consist of scintillator tiles with embedded wavelength-shifting fibers, clear-fiber optical cables, and multi-anode photomultiplier readout. A description of the detector design, test results from R&D studies, and construction phase are reported. The upgrade was installed late in 2004, and a large amount of proton-antiproton collider data has been collected since then. Detector studies using those data are also discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages

entry.title: The Status of CMS
entry.summary: After a brief overview of the Compact Muon Solenoid (CMS) experiment, the status of construction, installation and commissioning is described. Very good progress has been achieved in the past year. Though many significant challenges still lie ahead, CMS should be ready for recording data from first collisions in the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) accelerator complex at CERN
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 8 figures, Proceedings for the 2006 Hadron Collider Physics conference at Duke University

entry.title: CALICE Report to the Calorimeter R&D Review Panel
entry.summary: The report describes the status of the calorimeter R&D for ILC detector performed in the CALICE collaboration. This status has been presented to the review panel at the LCWS07 workshop at DESY in June 2007.
entry.arxiv:comment: 77 pages

entry.title: Tracking and vertexing at ATLAS
entry.summary: Several algorithms for tracking and for primary and secondary vertex reconstruction have been developed by the ATLAS collaboration following different approaches. This has allowed a thorough cross-check of the performances of the algorithms and of the reconstruction software. The results of the most recent studies on this topic are discussed and compared.

author.name: Pamela Ferrari
author.arxiv:affiliation: on behalf of the ATLAS and CMS Collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of the HCP 2006 conference

entry.title: ALICE Detector Status and Commissioning
entry.summary: The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) will start operation in the end of 2007 colliding proton and lead beams at \surd S = 14 TeV and \surd S_{NN} = 5.5 TeV, respectively. The accelerator and the experiments are under construction and detailed studies of the physics program are being prepared. I will in this paper review the current status of the ALICE experiment and the heavy ion physics aspects that are unique at LHC.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of HCP 2006

entry.title: The Yale Lar TPC
entry.summary: In this paper we give a concise description of a liquid argon time projection chamber (LAr TPC) developed at Yale, and present results from its first calibration run with cosmic rays.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 3 figures, NuInt07 Conference Proceedings

entry.title: ILC Positron Production Target Simulation
entry.summary: A photon-positron conversion target of the undulator or laser based polarized positron source is optimized using a modified GEANT-3 program adapted to count the spin transfer. High intensity positron beam with around 0.75 polarisation could be achieved choosing tungsten conversion target of 0.3 and 0.7 radiation lengths for the undulator and laser case respectively.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 5 figures, to appear in LCWS/ILC07 proceedings

entry.title: Intrinsic dissipation in cantilevers
entry.summary: We consider the effects of a velocity-independent friction force on cantilever damping. It is shown that this dissipation mechanism causes nonlinear effects in the cantilever vibrations. The size of the nonlinearity increases with decreasing cantilever velocity. Our analysis makes it possible to understand experiments [Stipe et al, PRL 87, 096801 (2001)] where an amplitude dependence of the cantilever eigenfrequency and anomalous dissipation was observed only at small amplitudes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: A New Supersensitive Flame Detector and its Use for Early Forest Fire Detection
entry.summary: A new flame detector, three orders of magnitude more powerful than the existing ones, is presented. This detector needs to be mass-produced for its use in order to be incorporated in an early forest fire detection system. A project able to implement its use to overcome the forest fire emergency is described.

entry.title: Particle Tracking with a Thin Pixel Telescope
entry.summary: We report results on a tracking performance study performed using a beam telescope made of 50 micron-thick CMOS pixel sensors on the 1.5 GeV electron beam at the LBNL ALS.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures, to appear in the Proceedings of the 2007 International Linear Collider Workshop, LCWS07, DESY, Hamburg, May-June 2007

entry.title: Monolithic Pixels R&D at LBNL
entry.summary: This paper reports recent results from the ongoing R&D on monolithic pixels for the ILC Vertex Tracker at LBNL.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of the LCWS International Linear Collider Workshop 2007, Hamburg, Germany

entry.title: The Detector DCR
entry.summary: The Detector Concept Report (DCR) consists of two parts, one for the physics and the other for ILC detectors. It has been prepared as the accompany document of the ILC Accelerator Reference Design Report. The detector DCR describes ILC detector designs, R&Ds on detector technologies and expected performances. The overview of the Detector DCR and the plan for the final release are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 8 figures, to appear in the proceedings of the Internationa Linear Collider Workshop LCWS2007, Hamburg, Germany

entry.title: A Silicon-Tungsten ECal with Integrated Electronics
entry.summary: We summarize recent R&D progress for a silicon-tungsten electromagnetic calorimeter (ECal) with integrated electronics, designed to meet the ILC physics requirements.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 figures To appear in Proc. of LCWS07, DESY, June 2007

entry.title: SiLC simulation status report
entry.summary: The SiLC - Silicon for the Linear Collider - collaboration aims to develop silicon detector technology for tracking in the international linear collider experiments. The R & D programme involves a substantial effort in simulation of the response of detector designs. In this contribution, an overview of ongoing efforts in this area is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: proceedings of LCWS07

entry.title: The Yale liquid argon time projection chamber
entry.summary: In this paper we give a thorough description of a liquid argon time projection chamber designed, built and operated at Yale. We present results from a calibration run where cosmic rays have been observed in the detector, a first in the US.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 11 figures. The quality of some of the figures has been reduced

entry.title: LHCb VELO software alignment, Part III: the alignment of the relative sensor positions
entry.summary: The LHCb Vertex Locator contains 42 silicon sensor modules. Each module has two silicon sensors. A method for determining the relative alignment of the silicon sensors within each module from data is presented. The software implementation details are discussed. Monte-Carlo simulation studies are described that demonstrate an alignment precision of 1.3 micron is obtained in the sensor plane.

entry.title: Photonic Time Stretch Enhanced Recording Scope
entry.summary: We demonstrate a new mode of operation for the Time Stretched A/D converter. The technique is superior to the sampling scope in that it permits the capture of non periodic events such as clustered noise.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to the 21st Annual Meeting of The IEEE Lasers & Electro-Optics Society

entry.title: A robust floating nanoammeter
entry.summary: A circuit capable of measuring nanoampere currents while floating at voltages up to at least 25kV is described. The circuit relays its output to ground potential via an optical fiber. We particularly emphasize the design and construction techniques which allow robust operation in the presence of high voltage spikes and discharges.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: The CMS Electromagnetic Calorimeter at the LHC
entry.summary: The CMS detector at the LHC is in the final stages of preparation. The high resolution Electromagnetic Calorimeter, which consists of nearly 76000 lead tungstate crystals, will play a crucial role in the coming physics searches undertaken by CMS. The design, status, and initial performance of the calorimeter, in test beams and with cosmic rays, will be reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: ICHEP08

entry.title: A High Energy Electron and Photon Detector Simulation System
entry.summary: A detailed Monte-Carlo code has been developed from basic principles that simulates almost all of the basic photon and charged particle interactions. The code is used to derive the response functions of a high energy photon detector to incident beams of photons of various energies. The detector response matrices (DRMs) are calculated using this code. Deconvolution of an artificially generated spectrum is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages,14 figures

entry.title: The PANDA Detector at FAIR
entry.summary: The PANDA detector is under design to be installed at the HESR storage ring for antiproton of the future FAIR facility in Darmstadt, Germany. Fundamental questions of hadron and nuclear physics interactions of antiprotons with nucleons and nuclei will be pursued using a multipurpose set-up which includes innovative detectors. Here, the FAIR facility and the PANDA detector are described.
entry.arxiv:comment: Parallel talk at ICHEP08, Philadelphia USA, July 2008. 4 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: The quest for the ideal photodetector for the next generation deep-underwater neutrino telescopes
entry.summary: We review photodetectors used in present running neutrino telescopes. After a brief historical discourse, the photodetector requirements for the next generation deep underwater neutrino telescopes are discussed. It is shown that large area vacuum hybrid phototubes are the closest to the ideal photodetector for such kind of applications when compared with other vacuum phototubes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: ATLAS Detector Status and Physics Startup Plans
entry.summary: The status of the ATLAS detector shortly before the start-up of the LHC is presented. The progress in the commissioning of the detector, as well as plans for early physics analysis are outlined.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at ICHEP08, Philadelphia, USA, July 2008. 10 pages PDF file

entry.title: Calorimetry for ILC Experiments: CALICE Collaboration R&D
entry.summary: The CALICE Collaboration is carrying out research and development into calorimetry for a detector at the International Linear Collider (ILC). CALICE is investigating a range of technologies for both electromagnetic and hadronic calorimetry. An overview of the prototypes and selected test-beam results are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of the ICHEP08 conference

entry.title: ZVMST: a minimum spanning tree-based vertex finder
entry.summary: A new topological vertex finder is presented which combines ideas of the well-established ZVTOP algorithm with a novel minimum spanning tree approach. A preliminary performance study with simulated e+e- --> qqbar events at a centre of mass energy of 92 GeV shows that the new approach is competitive with existing vertex finder algorithms.
entry.arxiv:comment: submitted as LC-note; 13 pages, 2 figures, 2 tables

entry.title: Novel Photo-Detectors and Photo-Detector Systems
entry.summary: Recent developments in photo-detectors and photo-detector systems are reviewed. The main emphasis is made on Silicon Photo-Multipliers (SiPM) - novel and very attractive photo-detectors. Their main features are described. Properties of detectors manufactured by different producers are compared. Different applications are discussed including calorimeters, muon detection, tracking, Cherenkov light detection, and time of flight measurements.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 6 figures, prepared for Position Sensitive Detectors 08

entry.title: Test Beam Requirements for the ILC Tracking and Vertex Detectors
entry.summary: In this report the test beam requirements for the vertex detector and the tracking detector for ILC are discussed. It focuses on the infrastructure needs of the different subsystems. In the second part of this summary the ideas about future infrastructure above the immediate needs are summarised.

entry.title: TPC Readout Electronics with Time-to-Digital Converters
entry.summary: Development of readout electronics for Time Projection Chamber for a Linear Collider is ongoing under stringent requirements on high channel density, lowest possible power consumption and small material budget. In the studied TPC readout electronics time and charge of TPC signals are measured with the help of Time-to-Digit Converters. Optimization of performance of this electronics is considered and a methodology of signal simulation is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 3 figures, uses ilcws08.cls

entry.title: Front-end Electronics for the CALICE/EUDET Calorimeters
entry.summary: The CALICE collaboration is involved in the design of compact calorimeters featuring a high granularity. The technical developments have to overcome various design issues such as the power dissipation, the integration of the front-end electronics inside the detector and connections between the parts. A huge collaborative work is required to achieve the devices using common tools and designs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 5 figures, talk given at LCWS08

entry.title: Improvements to the ILC Upstream Polarimeter
entry.summary: The physics programme of the ILC requires polarimetry with yet unprecedented precision. This note focusses on aspects of the upstream polarimeter as described in the ILC Reference Design Report which are not compatible with the extraordinary precision goals. In conclusion, recommendations for improving the design are given.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in the proceedings of LCWS 2008

entry.title: R&D status of FPCCD VTX
entry.summary: As a candidate of the vertex detector for experiments at ILC, fully depleted fine pixel CCDs (FPCCDs) are under development. We describe the basic concept of the FPCCD and report on preliminary results of the performance study of the first prototype FPCCD sensors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 3 figures, LCWS2008 Proceedings

entry.title: Simulating SiD Calorimetry: Software Calibration Procedures and Jet Energy Resolution
entry.summary: Simulated calorimeter performance in the SiD detector is examined. The software calibration procedures are described, as well as the perfect pattern recognition PFA reconstruction. Performance of the SiD calorimeters is summarized with jet energy resolutions from calorimetry only, perfect pattern recognition and the SiD PFA algorithm. Presented at LCWS08[1].
entry.arxiv:comment: LCWS08

entry.title: Detector Optimization for SiD using PFA
entry.summary: A summary of the optimization of the SiD detector is given. To optimize its performance in terms of Particle Flow Algorithms (PFA), five basic detector parameters have been varied and the impact on the obtained energy resolution using Particle Flow Algorithms has been studied using di-jets events. Finally the optimized detector used for the Letter of Intent (LoI) is briefly summarized as a result from these studies.

entry.title: Noise in a Calorimeter Readout System Using Periodic Sampling
entry.summary: Fourier transform analysis of the calorimeter noise problem gives quantitative results on a) the time-height correlation, b) the effect of background on optimal shaping and on the ENC, c) sampling frequency requirements, and d) the relation between sampling frequency and the required quantization error.

entry.title: Frequency of Positron Helicity Reversal
entry.summary: The ILC baseline design for the positron source is based on a helical undulator and will deliver a positron beam with a polarization of 30% or more. In this contribution the need for fast reversal of the positron helicity is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of International Linear Collider Workshop (LCWS08 and ILC08), Chicago, Illinois, 16-20 Nov 2008

entry.title: A Large TPC Prototype with MPGD Readout: Status and Plans
entry.summary: The use of a TPC in future collider experiments needs significant research and development. Within the EUDET program an infrastructure has been designed and built to allow the efficient testing of TPC prototypes under realistic conditions. The infrastructure consists of a test beam facility, located at DESY Hamburg, and a multi-purpose TPC field cage.
entry.arxiv:comment: Conference LCES 2008, Chicago

entry.title: Dual-readout, Particle Identification, and 4th
entry.summary: The 4th detector is rich in particle identification measurements from the dual-readout calorimeters, the cluster-timing tracking chamber, the muon spectrometer, and combinations of these systems. In all, a total of 13 measurements contribute to the identification of all partons of the standard model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 6 figures, TIPP09 Conference

entry.title: Development of detector active element based on thgem
entry.summary: A thick gas electron multiplier is considered for radiation-hard detectors (hadron calorimeter). There was carried out technological and design study to optimize the element structure. The measurements results and the next plans are presented.

author.name: V. Inshakov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for high energy physics, Protvino

author.name: V. Kryshkin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for high energy physics, Protvino

author.name: N. Kuzmin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Joint institute for nuclear research, Dubna

author.name: V. Skvortsov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for high energy physics, Protvino

author.name: S. Sychkov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Joint institute for nuclear research, Dubna

author.name: A. Sytin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for high energy physics, Protvino

entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 12 figures

entry.title: Towards quasi-biological nanodosimetry
entry.summary: The increasing utilization of charged particle beams for therapeutic purposes requires designing novel detector systems which shall be capable of assessing radiation quality for a diversity of ion species. It is shown that the pattern of energy deposition in thermoluminescent phosphors and biological tissue contains conceptual parallels. The correlation of physical and radiobiological parameters observed experimentally for specific endpoints (single- and double-strand breaks of DNA) opens the possibility of realizing successfully quasi-biological solid-state nanodosimetry on the basis of thermoluminescence.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Advances in Micro-Pattern Gaseous Detectors and their Applications
entry.summary: In the last decade, several new imaging gaseous detectors, called micro-pattern gaseous detectors, have been conceived and rapidly developed. In this paper, the most popular designs of these detectors and their applications to high energy physics and astrophysics experiments will be described. The main focus of this review will however be on the ongoing activities on practical applications of micro-pattern detectors to medicine and industry
entry.arxiv:comment: An invited talk at the IWASI-2009 Conference, Trani, Italy, 2009

entry.title: High Resolution Particle Beam Monitoring and Ionization Counters with the Help of Single Carbon Nanotubes
entry.summary: After a short review of modern beam monitors, ionization and proportional counters and discussion on the necessity to have thinner wires, we propose and consider construction and parameters of nanotube particle beam monitors and counters

entry.title: On the physics and technology of gaseous particle detectors
entry.summary: Despite an already long and fruitful history, gaseous elementary-particle detectors remain today an important mainstay of high-energy and nuclear physics experiments and of radiation detection in general. In here we briefly describe some of the gaseous detector's main technologies and applications, along with some unsolved gas-discharge physics aspects of practical relevance.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Plasma Sources in Science and Technology

entry.title: Liquid scintillator as tracking detector for high-energy events
entry.summary: A large-volume liquid scintillator can be used as a tracking detector to measure high-energy neutrino events, like atmospheric neutrinos and neutrino beams. The lepton flavor recognition is almost absolute above 1 GeV. The energy resolution is 2--5 %, the main uncertainties coming from nuclear physics and poorly recognized hadrons. At GeV scale antineutrinos may be statistically distinguishable from neutrinos by neutron and proton signals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages

entry.title: Memristive circuits simulate memcapacitors and meminductors
entry.summary: We suggest electronic circuits with memristors (resistors with memory) that operate as memcapacitors (capacitors with memory) and meminductors (inductors with memory). Using a memristor emulator, the suggested circuits have been built and their operation has been demonstrated, showing a useful and interesting connection between the three memory elements.

entry.title: Commissioning of the ATLAS Liquid Argon Calorimeters
entry.summary: A selection of ATLAS liquid argon (LAr) calorimeter commissioning studies is presented. It includes a coherent noise study, a measurement of the quality of the ionization pulse shape prediction, and energy and time reconstruction analyses with cosmic and single beam signals.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings from the CIPANP 2009 Conference

entry.title: QUASAR-370 hybrid phototube as a prototype of a photodetector for the next generation of deep underwater neutrino telescopes
entry.summary: In this paper we show that QUASAR-370 large area hybrid phototube developed for and successfully used in a number of astroparticle physics experiments, the lake Baikal deep underwater neutrino experiment among them, could be used as a prototype of a photodetector for the next generation of giant neutrino telescopes.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published in NIMA

entry.title: SiD Letter of Intent
entry.summary: Letter of intent describing SiD (Silicon Detector) for consideration by the International Linear Collider IDAG panel. This detector concept is founded on the use of silicon detectors for vertexing, tracking, and electromagnetic calorimetry. The detector has been cost-optimized as a general-purpose detector for a 500 GeV electron-positron linear collider.
entry.arxiv:comment: Letter of Intent for SiD detector concept presented to ILC IDAG

entry.title: Research on discharges in micropattern and small gap gaseous detectors
entry.summary: This report summarizes the present knowledge on discharges in micropattern and small gap gaseous detectors and the physical mechanisms involved. These include the space-charge (Raether's) limit, rate-induced breakdown, cathode excitation effect and electron emission from the cathodes in the form of jets, inter-GEM breakdown in multistep configurations and finally surface streamers.
entry.arxiv:comment: This report was written in the framework of the RD51 collaboration

entry.title: Improved primary vertex finding for collider detectors
entry.summary: Primary vertex finding for collider experiments is studied. The efficiency and precision of finding interaction vertices can be improved by advanced clustering and classification methods, such as agglomerative clustering with fast pairwise nearest neighbor search, followed by Gaussian mixture model or k-means clustering.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 10 figures, submitted to Nucl. Instrum. Meth. A

entry.title: LFS-3 - new radiation hard scintillator for electromagnetic calorimeters
entry.summary: Radiation damage of new heavy LFS-3 scintillating crystals has been studied using powerful $^{60}Co$ source at the dose rate of 4 Krad/min. No deterioration in optical transmission of LFS-3 crystals was observed after irradiation with the dose of 23 Mrad.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 1 figure, 1 table

entry.title: Inertia compensation while scanning screw threads on coordinate-measuring machines
entry.summary: Usage of scanning coordinate-measuring machines for inspection of screw threads has become a common practice nowadays. Compared to touch trigger probing, scanning capabilities allow to speed up measuring process while still maintaining high accuracy. However, in some cases accuracy drasticaly depends on the scanning speed. In this paper a compensation method is proposed allowing to reduce the influence of some dynamic effects while scanning screw threads on coordinate-measuring machines.

entry.title: Fods Hadron Calorimeters
entry.summary: There is described the design of the FODS hadron calorimeters, the procedure of the calibration and the results of the calorimeter study with electron and pion beams.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 9 figures

entry.title: Operation and calibration of the Silicon Drift Detectors of the ALICE experiment during the 2008 cosmic ray data taking period
entry.summary: The calibration and performance of the Silicon Drift Detector of the ALICE experiment during the 2008 cosmic ray run will be presented. In particular the procedures to monitor the running parameters (baselines, noise, drift speed) are detailed. Other relevant parameters (SOP delay, time-zero, charge calibration) were also determined.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, 14 figures

entry.title: Memristive Transfer Matrices
entry.summary: An electrical analysis is performed for a memristor crossbar array integrated with operational amplifiers including the effects of parasitic or contact resistances. It is shown that the memristor crossbar array can act as a transfer matrix for a multiple input-multiple output signal processing system. Special cases of the transfer matrix are described related to reconfigurable analog filters, waveform generators, analog computing, and pattern similarity. Keywords: transfer matrix, memristor, analog electronics, crossbar, operational amplifier, reconfigurable electronics

entry.title: Energy Calibration of Underground Neutrino Detectors using a 100 MeV electron accelerator
entry.summary: An electron accelerator in the 100 MeV range, similar to the one used at BNL's Accelerator test Facility, for example, would have some advantages as a calibration tool for water cerenkov or Liquid Argon neutrino detectors. We describe a compact secondary beam design that could be used for this application.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages,5 Figures.

entry.title: A new spin on spinning your samples: balancing rotors in a non-trivial manner
entry.summary: Due to a lack of coherent analysis, many common practices of humankind preserve low-efficient procedures. Balancing tubes during centrifugation exemplifies such a problem in laboratory practice. Using combination of symmetry group theory and genetic algorithm methodology we demonstrate that there is an array of surprisingly non-trivial algorithms for going about this procedure.

entry.title: Construction of a Digital Hadron Calorimeter
entry.summary: The DHCAL collaboration is assembling a large scale prototype Digital Hadron Calorimeter (DHCAL). The calorimeter utilizes Resistive Plate Chambers (RPCs) as active medium and features of the order of 400,000 1 \times 1 cm2 pads with binary (or digital) electronic readout. The purpose of the prototype is to provide detailed measurements of hadronic showers and to prove the concept of a DHCAL with RPCs as active elements.

entry.title: Miniature shock tube for laser driven shocks
entry.summary: We describe in this paper the design of a miniature shock tube (smaller than 1 cm3) that can be placed in a vacuum vessel and allows transverse optical probing and longitudinal backside XUV emission spectroscopy. Typical application is the study of laser launched radiative shocks, in the framework of what is called "laboratory Astrophysics".

entry.title: Overview of Spanish Tracking R&D for FLC
entry.summary: An overview of the present and foreseen R&D activities of the Spanish network for future accelerators aiming to participate in the design and construction of the forward tracker and vertex detectors of the Future Linear Colliders, is shown.

author.name: Alberto Ruiz-Jimeno
author.arxiv:affiliation: IFCA, Instituto de Fisica de Cantabria

entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 8 Figures, LCWS10 Conference Proceedings

entry.title: Simulation of Beam-Beam Background at CLIC
entry.summary: The dense beams used at CLIC to achieve a high luminosity will cause a large amount of background particles through beam-beam interactions. Generator level studies with GuineaPig and full detector simulation studies with an ILD based CLIC detector have been performed to evaluate the amount of beam-beam background hitting the vertex detector.
entry.arxiv:comment: LCWS/ILC10 Conference Proceedings

entry.title: Asian Test Beam Facilities
entry.summary: In Japan, China and Russia, there are several test beam lines available or will become available in near future. Those are open for users who need electron, muon and charged pion beams with energies of 1-50 GeV for any tests of small-size detectors. In this manuscript I present a current status of those test beam facilities in the Asian region.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings for LCWS 2010

entry.title: Track Segments within Hadronic Showers using the CALICE AHCal
entry.summary: Using the high granular CALICE analog hadron calorimeter (AHCal) a tracking algorithm capable of identifying MIP-like tracks within hadronic showers is presented. Such an algorithm provides excellent tools for detector calibration and for studies of the substructure of hadronic showers. The properties of the identified tracks are used as observables for a Monte-Carlo to data comparison.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 9 figures, LCWS2010 Proceeding

entry.title: KEK GRID for ILC Experiments
entry.summary: The LCG GRID system is the indispensable infrastructure for large scale computing required for ILC experiments. It had been used extensively for ILD LOI studies and its use will be further increased in coming DBD studies. Experiences during the LOI era and plan towards DBD study in KEK are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures, proceedings of the Internationa Linear Collider Workshop LCWS2010, Beijing, China

entry.title: Test Beams Summary
entry.summary: ILC detectors are required to have unprecedented precision. Achieving this requires significant investment for test beam activities to complete the detector R&D needed, to test prototypes and (later) to qualify final detector system designs, including integrated system test. This document summarizes the discussion at this workshop on the test beam facilities and detector R&D programs to be performed there.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 figures. Proceedings of International Linear Collider Workshop 2010 (LCWS2010)

entry.title: Test Beam Results Using an RPC Semi-Digital HCAL
entry.summary: We report on the development of an GRPCs (Glass Resistive Plate chambers) Semi- Digital hadron calorimeter for the future International Linear Collider (ILC).Two types of GRPCs (small and 1m2) were tested in PS beam at CERN. Detector performances are presented here in terms of efficiency, pad multiplicity, homogeneity and stability in time.

entry.title: Semi-DHCAL software developments: Digitization and Display
entry.summary: GRPC Semi-Digital HCAL is a solid option for the PFA oriented calorimetry of the International Linear Collider. Together with the hardware, the software developments is progressing steadily. The stauts and plans for the GRPC SDHCAL software development are presented, as well the first order digitization module for the GRPC and the display program DRUID (Display Root module Used for ILD) have been introduced.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceeding of LCWS 2010, Beijing

entry.title: Cherenkov Light Imaging - Fundamentals and recent Developments
entry.summary: We review in a historical way the fundamentals of Cherenkov light imaging applied to Ring Imaging Cherenkov Counters. We also point out some of the newer developments in this very active field.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to special edition of NIMA, Proceedings of RICH2010

entry.title: TORCH: Time of Flight Identification with Cherenkov Radiation
entry.summary: TORCH is a time-of-flight detector concept using Cherenkov light to provide charged particle identification up to 10 GeV/c. The concept and design are described and performance in simulation is quantified.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 3 figures, proceedings of RICH2010 to be published in Nucl. Instrum. Meth. A

entry.title: The NA62 RICH detector
entry.summary: The RICH detector of the NA62 experiment is proposed for pion - muon separation and to contribute to the first level of the trigger. The design parameters of the detector and the results of test beams performed at CERN in 2007 and 2009 with a prototype are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 figures, To appear in the proceedings of 12th Topical Seminar on Innovative Particle and Radiation Detectors (IPRD10), Siena, Italy, 7-10 June 2010

entry.title: Construction of a Prototype Spark Chamber
entry.summary: A small demonstration spark chamber is to be built at the Cavendish laboratory. A prototype chamber consisting of five 20x22.5cm plates has been built and descriptions of its properties and construction are given, while a second chamber with a somewhat novel design is nearly complete. A discussion of the issues surrounding the final design is presented, and recommendations are made in light of the results of this work.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages

entry.title: Fast timing detectors for forward protons at the LHC
entry.summary: I discuss the development of high precision timing detectors for high momentum protons at the LHC, and their application in studying exclusive Higgs boson production.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, talk at Workshop on Timing Detectors, Krakow, Dec 2010

entry.title: Note on Drexel tests of the IMB R1408 PMTs used in the inner veto of both far and near detectors of the Double Chooz experiment
entry.summary: This report is related to the testing performed at Drexel University of 250 R1408 PMTs. Based on this testing, 156 R1408 PMTs were chosen to be used in the inner veto of the detectors of the Double Chooz experiment.

entry.title: CALICE Report to the DESY Physics Research Committee, April 2011
entry.summary: We present an overview of the CALICE activities on calorimeter development for a future linear collider. We report on test beam analysis results, the status of prototype development and future plans.
entry.arxiv:comment: 71 pages, many figures

entry.title: Comment on 'Simultaneous gravity and gradient measurements from a recoil-compensated absolute gravimeter'
entry.summary: The article (Niebauer et al. 2011 Metrologia 48 154-163) reports on the important innovations enhancing the ability of absolute gravimeter to measure vertical gravity gradient along with the gravity acceleration. This comment suggests experiments to further assess the improvements and the results obtained with the modified instrument, considers some limitations of non-linear models in metrology and ways to overcome them, and discusses possible applications of the described instrument.

entry.title: Analysis of Kelvin Probe Operational Models
entry.summary: We present a study of several models on which Kelvin Probe instruments with flat and spherical tips rely for operation and for the determination of the contact potential difference. Using covariance analysis, we have investigated the precision limits of each model as imposed by the Cramer-Rao bound. Where the situation demanded, we have evaluated the bias introduced by the method in the estimation of the contact potential difference.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, 16 figures

entry.title: Proton induced damage in LFS-3 and LFS-8 scintillating crystals
entry.summary: Scintillating LFS-3 and LFS-8 crystals were exposed to a 155 MeV/c proton fluence $\Phi_{p}=(4.4\pm0.4)\cdot10^{12}cm^{-2}$. There was negligible reduction in transmission spectrum of LFS-3 crystal measured in 30 days after irradiation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures, 1 table

entry.title: Evolution of Photonic Time Stretch: From Analog to Digital Conversion to Blood Screening
entry.summary: We show how the ability to slow down, amplify, and capture fast transient events can produce high-throughput real-time instruments ranging from digitizers to imaging flow cytometers for detection of rare diseased cells in blood.

entry.title: Silicon Photomultipliers for High Energy Physics Detectors
entry.summary: In this paper I want to review the current status of development of multi-pixel silicon-based avalanche photo-diodes operated in Geiger mode, also known as Silicon Photomultipliers (SiPM). Particular emphasis is given to the application of this type of photo-sensors in high energy physics detectors.

entry.title: Radiation hardness study of calorimeter active elements
entry.summary: There are presented the results of radiation hardness study of calorimeter active elements. One element is based on organic scintillator with wave length shifting fiber light collection. The other one is an element based on a Thick Gas Electron Multiplier.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 6 figures
